[[File:Occupy Wall Street Anonymous 2011 Shankbone.JPG|thumb|A member holding an Anonymous flier at [[Occupy Wall Street]], a protest that the group actively supported, September 17, 2011]]
[[File:Occupy Wall Street Anonymous 2011 Shankbone.JPG|thumb|A member holding an Anonymous flier at [[Occupy Wall Street]], a protest that the group actively supported, September 17, 2011]]
==Background==
==Background==
  +
{{also|2011 United States public employee protests}}
The demonstration is leaderless,<ref>{{Cite news | title=US protesters rally to occupy Wall Street |url= http://stream.aljazeera.com/story/us-protesters-rally-occupy-wall-street | date=17 September 2011 | accessdate=17 September 2011}}</ref> although it was originally organized by ''[[Adbusters]]'', a [[Canada|Canadian]] [[anti-consumerist]] magazine. The [[hacktivism|hacktivist]] group [[Anonymous (group)|Anonymous]] incited its followers to take part in the protest, which increased the attention it received.<ref name="cnn"/> Other groups followed, typically of [[anti-capitalist]] and [[radical leftism|radical leftist]] persuasions, including the NYC General Assembly and U.S. Day of Rage.<ref name="ibtimes"/> Organizers hoped to bring between 20,000-90,000 protesters to Wall Street, but only several hundred people have joined the demonstration so far.<ref name="cnn"/><ref>[http://www.truthdig.com/avbooth/item/anti-corporate_protesters_demonstrate_at_wall_street_20110918/ Anti-Corporate Protesters Demonstrate on Wall Street], TruthDig.com, 18 September 2011</ref>
The demonstration is leaderless,<ref>{{Cite news | title=US protesters rally to occupy Wall Street |url= http://stream.aljazeera.com/story/us-protesters-rally-occupy-wall-street | date=17 September 2011 | accessdate=17 September 2011}}</ref> although it was originally organized by ''[[Adbusters]]'', a [[Canada|Canadian]] [[anti-consumerist]] magazine. The [[hacktivism|hacktivist]] group [[Anonymous (group)|Anonymous]] incited its followers to take part in the protest, which increased the attention it received.<ref name="cnn"/> Other groups followed, typically of [[anti-capitalist]] and [[radical leftism|radical leftist]] persuasions, including the NYC General Assembly and U.S. Day of Rage.<ref name="ibtimes"/> Organizers hoped to bring between 20,000-90,000 protesters to Wall Street, but only several hundred people have joined the demonstration so far.<ref name="cnn"/><ref>[http://www.truthdig.com/avbooth/item/anti-corporate_protesters_demonstrate_at_wall_street_20110918/ Anti-Corporate Protesters Demonstrate on Wall Street], TruthDig.com, 18 September 2011</ref>
